channel.title: vsts on David Wesst
channel.description: Recent content in vsts on David Wesst

item.title: Conquest April 2017 Devblog
item.description: This is the April 2017 update for my video game project I call “Conquest”. This month, I have continued to make progress on my game project. The unexpected thing that happened was the fact that I decided to take a step back and do some research and development before continuing forward with the game idea I have in mind. Status Update Here’s the thing: my game project is too big. At least for now, it’s too big, and I don’t have enough experience and knowledge to be co fortable taking this idea and turning it into a game.

item.title: Introducing My Game Project - March 2017 Devblog
item.description: I’ve wanted to make a video game since I was very young. It got me into programming during my university career, and is something of a passion of mine now that I’m older and more of a seasoned developer. I’ve toyed and tinkered with different game ideas and technologies through the years, but never really got anything done. At the beginning of this year, I started working on something I decided would be my first “real” game.

item.title: How to Blog with VSTS (Part 4)
item.description: This is part 4 of 5 of my How to Blog with VSTS series. Links to the other parts will be added as they are made available. Part 1: Setup Part 2: Code Part 3: Work Part 4: Build Part 5: Release I’ve been tinkering with Visual Studio Team Services off and on since its public release, but never did anything really productive with it. Over the past couple of weeks, I finally bit the bullet and decided to move my most prevelant personal project into VSTS: this blog.
